components.label: HTML
components.content:
BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund

Stream 1 – Project Readiness Proposal

This is step one of a two-step application process. If you have already submitted a proposal and received notification that your project is eligible to submit a detailed application, please check your email for the link to the detailed application form.

Please review the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund (MJF) Program Guide before completing your proposal. You may contact MJF staff at ManufacturingJobsFund@gov.bc.ca to discuss your project and receive guidance on completing the form.

The following questions are for businesses and for-profit organizations applying to Stream 1: Project Readiness, which supports final-stage business and project planning and operational/technical assessments required for a capital project/investment.

Completing the Online Form

  • The proposal will take approximately 30-60 minutes to complete.
  • You can save drafts and return to the form at any time to review and edit your responses before submitting your proposal. Click on "VIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS" to review your list of in progress submissions and select "Edit" to continue inputting information.
  • Be sure to save your draft proposal regularly (every 10 – 15 minutes) by clicking the save icon on the top right-hand corner of the window.
  • After you have submitted, you can view your completed proposal at any time by logging into the form and selecting "VIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS." You can also select "EMAIL A RECEIPT OF THIS SUBMISSION" to receive an email with a link to your completed proposal.
  • If you would like to submit more than one proposal, click on "VIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS" then select the plus sign at the top right-hand corner to start a new submission. 

Application Process and Next Steps

  • This proposal is step one of a two-step application process.
  • You will hear from us within four weeks to confirm if your project has been selected to move to the next stage, which consists of completing a full application with more detailed project and business documentation.

Applications submitted under the program are subject to the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. The information being collected is for the purpose of administering the program and will be used for the purpose of evaluating eligibility under the program. Information collected through the application process may be disclosed to Government of British Columbia staff outside of the Manufacturing Jobs Fund in order to conduct due diligence on this application. In addition, the applicant organization’s name, location, funded activity, and award amount may be made publicly available, including worldwide by way of the Internet, should funding be awarded.

components.label: I consent to information provided about my project being shared with provincial and federal government departments and agencies in the interest of exploring matching funding opportunities.

components.html:
Stream 1: Project Readiness provides contributions toward final-stage business and project planning, including operational and technical assessments for a capital project.

In this section, we will ask you questions about the proposed capital project you are planning for, as well as questions about the planning and assessment activities you need to complete before undertaking the capital project. 

Please note that funding through Stream 1 is for planning and/or assessment activities only. Successful recipients of Stream 1 funding may apply to Stream 2 when ready; however, receipt of Stream 1 funding does not guarantee Stream 2 funding approval.
components.label: Text/Images
Select the BC Economic Development Region where your project will take place (choose all that apply):
What community(ies) will your project take place in?
Does the project involve partnerships, either formal or informal (e.g., First Nations community, local government or other business)?
If yes, list your partners and briefly indicate their specific role(s) in the project:
Which of the following best describes the planning/assessment activities you are seeking Stream 1 funding for (choose all that apply):

values.label: Investment planning (for First Nations and Indigenous and First Nation-owned entities only)

components.label: Provide additional detail about the planning/assessment activities and why they are required. Include information about the approach you will take, including whether you will use contracted services or, if not, who will be completing the work.
What other activities have you completed to prepare for the proposed project?
Which of the following best describes the purpose of the proposed capital project that you are planning for (choose all that apply):

values.label: New manufacturing business venture or business start-up
Diversifying business line with new product
Enhancing viability, efficiency and/or productivity of current business
Acquisition of or investment into existing manufacturing company (for First Nations and Indigenous or First Nation-owned enterprises only)

components.label: Describe the proposed capital project, including a description of major project deliverables and expenses, the intended outcomes, and the product(s) you will be manufacturing/processing.

components.content: Planning and Assessment Timelines and Readiness

components.label: What stage of readiness is your project currently in?

values.label: Validation in lab or simulated environment
Final stage planning and close to implementation
Ready for deployment in operational setting/implementation

components.label: When will you begin the planning and/or assessment activities?
When do you expect to complete the planning and/or assessment activities?
When do you expect to begin the proposed capital project? This should be after planning and/or assessment activities are complete.
How long do you expect the proposed capital project to take before it is complete?
What is the total estimated/approximate budget for your proposed capital project?
What is the total eligible budget for your planning and assessment activities?
What is your funding request to MJF? Note that the Project Readiness stream funds a maximum of $50,000 up to 50% of the total planning/assessment costs.
HTML
components.content:
How are you funding your planning and assessment activities?

List your confirmed and prospective funding sources for your planning/assessment activities, including your request to the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund.

components.html: Ensure your Total Revenues in the bottom row match your total planning and assessment budget above.
components.label: Text/Images
Total Revenues

components.html:
In Step 2 of the application process, you will be asked to provide supporting documentation about the business and project. However, you are encouraged to submit any relevant documents you have prepared at this time.

Please do not include documents with any personal information about yourself or your employees, including employee names, addresses, employment information, or any other personally identifiable information. 

Examples include: 

  • Business and project planning documentation (e.g., business plan, market assessment, financial forecasts)
  • Quotes
  • Letters of support
  • Confirmation of other funding sources
components.label: Text/Images
Upload your files here. Please note that only Excel, Word and PDF files are accepted. Max file size is 25MB.
Previous
Next
HTML
components.content:
Attestation

By submitting this form, I confirm that I have the authority to submit this request and agree to the conditions described below.

  1. All information contained herein is correct and complete to the best of my knowledge;

  2. Awarding of funding to successful applicants will be conditional upon finalization of a contribution agreement that sets out the terms and conditions of the funding (“Funds”);

  3. I consent to receiving email communications regarding this proposal from the Province of B.C. in relation to the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund;

  4. I agree to retain supporting documentation and information including but not limited to invoices and receipts, for all expenditures made using the Funds (collectively, the “Supporting Documentation”) for a period of seven years from the date of receipt of the Funds;

  5. I agree that I will provide the Province with additional Supporting Documentation relating to my proposal or to the use of the Funds received, and agree that the Province may, at any reasonable time and on reasonable notice, attend at my place of business or other premises to inspect, and, at the Province’s discretion, review, copy and audit any records and other materials comprising or relating to the Supporting Documentation, whether produced by or provided to my business, where such records and other materials are the result of or related to the use of Funds and that I will provide reasonable assistance to the Province in exercising these rights; and

  6. I agree that repayment of Funds may be required if the Funds, or any part of them, are used for purposes other than those identified in the program materials as eligible expenses, or if my business is found to be ineligible or if any information provided in this proposal is not true and accurate.

components.label: I confirm that I have the authority to submit this request and agree to the conditions described above.
